hackathon-description-text: At its core, CrimsonHacks is about bringing hackers from all over the south for a weekend of innovation. For 24 hours, 200 students from around the southeast will come together in Tuscaloosa at The University of Alabama for a weekend of innovation, free food, and of course, free swag.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of STEM Path to the MBA at The University of Alabama
Associate Professor of Computer Science at The University of Alabama

hackathon-eligibility: In order to be eligible for the event and for prizes:
hackathon-rules:
To be eligible for prizes, submissions must be new projects created on or after April 14, 2018. That is, participants may not submit projects that have prior written code.
To be eligible for the Best Rookie Hack category, all team members of that project must be first-time hackathon attendees.
All participants, sponsors, organizers, and attendees must abide by the 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Lockheed Martin - Best Data Visualization Tool*
Pariveda - Best Project for Social Good
